intro: Mirabilis pauciflora, commonly known as the sparse-flowered four-o'clock, is a species of flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Nyctaginaceae and is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that open in the late afternoon. The plant typically grows as a herbaceous perennial, producing clusters of vibrant pink or red blooms. It thrives in well-drained soils and prefers full sun to partial shade. Mirabilis pauciflora is often cultivated for its ornamental value and unique blooming pattern.
